item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Leslie Ludy
item.description: "Stop trying to fit [Christ] into your life; instead, build your life around [Him]." -- Leslie Ludy

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gary Chapman
item.description: "Love is a verb." -- Gary Chapman

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "Then he made one last effort to search in his heart for the place where his affection had rotted away, and he could not find it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "Both looked back then on the wild revelry...and they lamented that it had cost them so much of their lives to find the paradise of shared solitude." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "He repeated until his dying day that there was no one with more common sense, no stone cutter more obstinate, no manager more lucid or dangerous, than a poet." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "But I love your feet only because they walked upon the earth and upon the wind and upon the waters, until they found me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "so I wait for you like a lonely house till you will see me again and live in me. Till then my windows ache." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "To feel the love of people whom we love is a fire that feeds our life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I am no longer in love with her, that's certain, but maybe I love her. Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "And the verse falls to the soul like dew to the pasture." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago. Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Is it possible, in the final analysis, for one human being to achieve perfect understanding of another? We can invest enormous time and energy in serious efforts to know another person, but in the end, how close can we come to that person's essence? We convince ourselves that we know the other person well, but do we really know anything important about anyone?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description:
"So I made up my mind I was going to find someone who would love me unconditionally three hundred and sixty-five days a year.
Watanabe: Wow, and did your search pay off?
M: That's the hard part. I guess I've been waiting so long I'm looking for perfection. That makes it tough." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Love can rebuild the world, they say, so everything's possible when it comes to love." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "She would not shed a tear, she would not waste the rest of her years simmering in the maggot broth of memory." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "The children would remember for the rest of their lives the august solemnity with which their father, devastated by his prolonged vigil and by the wraith of his imagination, revealed his discovery to them: 'The world is round, like an orange." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "1) I love you not for whom you are, but who i am when i'm by your side. 2) No person deserves your tears, and who deserves them won't make you cry. 3) Just because someone doesn't love you as you wish, it doesn't mean you're not loved with all his/her being. 4) A true friend is the one, who hold your hand and touches your heart. 5) The worst way to miss someone is, to be seated by him/her and know you'll never have him/her. 6) Never stop smiling not even when you're sad, someone might fall in love with your smile. 7) You may only be a person in this world, but for someone you're the world. 8) Don't spend time with someone, who doesn't care spending it with you. 9) Maybe God wants you to meet many wrong people, before you meet the right one,so when it happens you'll be thankful. 10) Dont cry because it came to an end, smile because it happened. 11) There will always be people who'll hurt you, so you need to continue trusting, just be careful. 12) Become a better person and be sure to know who you are, before meeting someone new and hoping that person knows who you are. 13) Don't struggle so much, best things happen when not expected." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
item.description: "Those who wanted to sleep, not from fatigue but because of the nostalgia of dreams..." -- Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "[...] not knowing what he was doing because he did not know where his feet were or where his head was, or whose feet or whose head, and feeling that he could no longer resist the glacial rumbling of his kidneys and the air of his intestines, and fear, and the bewildered anxiety to flee and at the same time stay forever in that exasperated silence and that fearful solitude." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "He recognized her despite the uproar, through his tears of unrepeatable sorrow at dying without her, and he looked at her for the last and final time with eyes more luminous, more grief-stricken, more grateful than she had ever seen them in half a century of a shared life, and he managed to say to her with his last breath: “Only God knows how much I loved you" -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez (Author)
item.description: "To all, I would say how mistaken they are when they think that they stop falling in love when they grow old, without knowing that they grow old when they stop falling in love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez (Author)

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "The truth is I'm getting old, I said. We already are old, she said with a sigh. What happens is that you don't feel it on the inside, but from the outside everybody can see it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Jhomileen add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair." -- Haruki Murakami
